Description: Key Responsibilities:- Radio Engineering Excellence: Utilize your in-depth knowledge of radio systems to design, install, troubleshoot, and optimize telecommunications networks, ensuring optimal performance and reliability.- On-Site Technical Support: Engage in field activities, conducting site surveys, and addressing technical challenges to maintain seamless operations.- Project Management Collaboration: Embrace a Project Manager's perspective as you work closely with cross-functional teams, contributing insights into project planning, timelines, and technical feasibility.- Client Engagement: Interact with clients to understand their requirements, provide technical recommendations, and ensure the successful delivery of projects.- Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate records, generate comprehensive reports, and contribute to project documentation, enhancing transparency and knowledge sharing. Skills
Skills: - Bachelor's degree in Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering, or related field.
- 5 years of experience in Radio Engineering, with a strong foundation in radio system design, deployment, and maintenance.
- Familiarity with project management principles and a collaborative approach to working in cross-functional teams.
- Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude towards technical challenges.
- Strong communication skills to engage with clients, present technical information, and contribute to project discussions.
Project management certifications (PMP, PRINCE2) are a plus.
